item.title: I’m Supposed to Write on Water, but I Don’t Have Any…
item.description: ![Broken Pipe via Starbuck Powersurge @ flickr]({{ site.url }}{{ site.root }}{{ site.images_dir }}/{{ page.date | date: “%Y” }}/262341270_2017b87199.jpg) Today the Interweb Gods have deemed is World Blog about water day. Or likely more accurately, the brilliant change.org marketers have deemed today as world blog about water:Day. I haven’t read every post I have seen come across my various Twitter wires, but the ones I’ve read talk about the need for us to have water.

item.title: On Going Local: Finding Your Happy Place
item.description: On Going Local is a new (short) series that I’ll be running which will attempt to look at my life from an objective perspective as I transition from and NGO worker into an entrepreneur here in the developing world. ![My Happy Place via Lady_k @ flickr]({{ site.url }}{{ site.root }}{{ site.images_dir }}/{{ page.date | date: “%Y” }}/4431206216_8eacda9a75_z.jpg) Photo via Lady_k @ flickr I’ve been here in Somaliland now for around two and a half years now.

item.title: On Going Local: Water
item.description: On Going Local is a new (short) series that I’ll be running which will attempt to look at my life from an objective perspective as I transition from and NGO worker into an entrepreneur here in the developing world. ![Washing Hands]({{ site.url }}{{ site.root }}{{ site.images_dir }}/{{ page.date | date: “%Y” }}/4610058219_4e31ee3ce2.jpg) via dougni @ flickr When I first arrived here in S’land, and I would go out to eat, I would use the minimum amount of water possible to wash my hands before and after eating with them.
